question_sentence: A US embassy in what country was attacked by protesters demonstrating against American airstrikes?
evidence: Pro-Iranian  demonstrators -- mostly from a coalition of predominantly Shiite militias -- tried to storm the US embassy in Baghdad. They were protesting five US airstrikes on militia-controlled facilities in Iraq and Syria that killed 25 and wounded 51.

question_sentence: This artist is the first to score a No. 1 hit on the Billboard Hot 100 chart across four different decades.
evidence: Carey’s holiday earworm, “All I Want for Christmas Is You,” topped the Billboard chart in the 1990s, 2000s, 2010s and finally, the 2020s. Carey released a new music video in December that ushered the song into 2020 with a steady stream of new views.

question_sentence: New Year’s fireworks displays in this city happened despite a public petition calling for them to be cancelled.
evidence: Australian officials faced increasing pressure to cancel the event in the midst of a devastating bushfire season. More than a quarter of a million people signed a petition calling for the money that’s usually spent on the fireworks display to go toward firefighting efforts.

question_sentence: The US Army has banned soldiers from using which popular app on government-owned phones?
evidence: The US Army joined the Navy in barring use of the app on government-owned phones after lawmakers raised concerns about whether the Chinese-owned app presents risks to national security or Americans’ personal data information.

question_sentence: Five people were wounded during a religious celebration when a man entered and attacked the faithful with a machete. Which religious tradition did the victims belong to?
evidence: The attacker entered the New York home of a rabbi where a Hanukkah celebration was taking place. There were nearly 100 people in the home at the time of the attack, an attendee said. Five people, including the rabbi’s son, were taken to a hospital.

question_sentence: On January 1, a law went into effect that legalizes recreational marijuana in which state?
evidence: The law, which passed in June, lets anyone 21 and older buy and possess recreational marijuana. It also pardons people with nonviolent convictions of having up to 30 grams of cannabis.

question_sentence: Earthlings ushered in a new decade this week. People in which places got to celebrate the New Year first?
evidence: Of places across all 39 time zones, these Pacific Islands fall at the head of the pack, saying hello to 2020 before the rest of the world.

question_sentence: Which two companies are suing California over its law that requires “gig workers” to be considered employees instead of independent contractors?
evidence: The companies filed suit in federal court, claiming the law violates parts of the US and California constitutions.

question_sentence: A new report ranks this diet as the “best” diet for the third year in a row.
evidence: A panel of judges ranked diets based on factors including balance, maintainability, sustainability and healthfulness. The Mediterranean diet -- which emphasizes plant-based cooking with less red meat and more olive oil and fish -- snatched the top spot.

question_sentence: Which Democratic presidential candidate announced the end of their campaign this week?
evidence: Castro, the only Latino to run in the 2020 election cycle, announced the end of his campaign in a video posted to Twitter. The candidate struggled to raise enough money and support in polls over the last year.
